Elicitation_Notes: dibuat dari bambu untuk menangkap ikan yang ditinggal. NOT fish net or fish line.
A type of lizard that makes a ‘toke’ sound
Specifically, that type of tree, not any white wood. Try to probe deeper if a calque of “white tree” is given first.
There may be two types, a high one (for e.g. storage) and a lower one; if so, elicit both.
menjatuhkan
To crouch as on an Indonesian toilet, NOT: to kneel
If you can, show a picture.
Please elicit the verb
In South Sulawesi: iga
Destroys rice crops and gives off a bad smell when disturbed.
Mimic the movement, we look for the painful one
Please ensure to elicit the noun
Elicit time of day, not prayer – ‘fajar’ may be helpful in some regions

English: mound of stones for ritual activities
Elicitation_Notes: The cultural features questionnaire also asks for this term.
Refers to a specific type of corn porridge which may not exist in all areas
Often taboo. Be sensitive, explain: ini sehingga anggota tubuh semua  bisa dimasukkan dalam dalam kamus, itu saja, jangan marah bapak? If they still remain silent, skip.
If the word "gebang" is not recognized, try "g(e)wang"
If there are different words for male and female sarongs, collect the female one.
There might not be a general term. If there isn’t, leave it empty.
Not: rumah sempit (crowded/small house), or pakaian sempit (clothes that are too tight).
Specifically, the singular one.

English: louse in hair; head louse; mother louse

Elicitation_Notes: There might not be a term like this, between bird and chicken. If there isn’t, leave it empty.
Please specify which type of ceremony(s) is given
Like 'membangunkan' (but not with the sense of 'to erect a building')
DO NOT ELICIT THIS, this is a legacy concept covered elsewhere
Ketika mata pedih dan merah kemudian ketika bangun tidur mata sulit dibuka dan kadang-kadang keluar cairan kuning.
Of spear (tombak) or machete (parang); if there are two different words, elicit both.
kabut = fog, NOT embun = air yang menetes dari daun di pagi hari
NOT 'debu' (dust, after you have been sweeping)
If there are different words for the place and the direction, elicit both and annotate.
If there is confusion, ask for ‘di sini’

English: to search for; to hunt for

Elicitation_Notes: Kata untuk seluru alat menenun. Tetapi di sini alat tenun tidak ada nama umum, dan masing-masing bagian ada namanya. (It is likely that there is no word referring to a loom as such,  only words referring to parts of it. If you can make a picture of a loom, you could try to elicit the words for the various parts. If this is not possible, just skip this.)

Or try ‘tulang belakang’
Negation of verbal/adjectival predicate, e.g. Saya tidak suka minum bir; Saya tidak sakit. (Not 'bukan').
Not 'married woman'
NOT: ‘linggis’=‘crowbar’

English: thatch; reed or grass used for making roofs
ground for ritual activities and public meetings
Elicitation_Notes: The cultural features questionnaire also asks for this term.
NOT ‘urat daging’/‘tendon’, or any other string in the body
Or ‘telapak’
If there is a distinction between unhusked rice still on the harvested plant and rice corns in the husks, but removed from the grain head, take the one for the first meaning.
There may be several words, e.g. sakit setelah dipukul (pain felt after being hit); sakit luka (pain of a wound), or sakit demam (have a fever). We look for the word used for sakit demam.

Indonesian: paman; ibu py saudara laki-laki; om

Elicitation_Notes: NOT ‘smelly’ if there are different words for both.
If there are different words for the place and the direction, elicit both and annotate.
Not 'manusia' (human being). Elicit 'orang' with a numeral, for example 'ada satu orang, dua orang, tiga orang...'
Often taboo. Be sensitive, explain: ini sehingga anggota tubuh semua  bisa dimasukkan dalam dalam kamus, itu saja, jangan marah bapak? If they still remain silent, skip.

English: to dwell; to live; to stay

Elicitation_Notes: If the word for ‘short stick’ and ‘short man’ differ, elicit both. Do not elicit ‘short time’.

If they ask which animals, say 'kata untuk .... seperti sapi, ayam, kambing.' (If they also have a different word for animals that are not eaten, e.g. rats (tikus) or snakes (ular), then that is NOT the word we look for.)
